hero.headline: GPT-5.2-Codex Launches: OpenAI's Most Advanced Agentic Coding Model Yet
hero.summary: OpenAI released GPT-5.2-Codex on December 18, 2025, achieving an unprecedented 56.4% on SWE-Bench Pro and 64% on Terminal-Bench 2.0. The model features context compaction for long-horizon work, stronger refactoring and migration capabilities, improved Windows support, and significantly enhanced cybersecurity capabilities that already led to discovering CVEs in React.
hero.whyItMatters: This release intensifies the agentic coding wars. With Claude Code at $1B revenue, Gemini 3 Flash hitting 78% SWE-bench, and now GPT-5.2-Codex pushing benchmarks further, developers have never had more powerful AI coding options. The cybersecurity angle is particularly notable - a researcher using GPT-5.1-Codex-Max found and disclosed React vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-55183, CVE-2025-55184, CVE-2025-67779) just last week.

topStories.title: Run Your Own AI Cluster at Home: Exo Gains 437 Stars Today
topStories.summary: Exo lets you run AI models across everyday devices like phones, laptops, and desktops - creating a distributed inference cluster without expensive GPUs. Today it's trending on GitHub as developers explore local AI alternatives to cloud APIs.

topStories.title: Mini-SGLang: Lightweight LLM Serving Engine Explodes on GitHub
topStories.summary: SGLang Project released mini-sglang, a simplified implementation of their popular LLM serving framework. With 501 stars gained today, it's becoming the go-to for developers who want fast, efficient LLM inference without complexity.

topStories.title: Supply Chain Attack Hits X, Vercel, Cursor, Discord via Popular Libraries
topStories.summary: A documented exploit affecting major platforms through dependency vulnerabilities is making rounds on Hacker News with 691 points. The attack demonstrates how compromised npm packages can cascade through modern development toolchains.

topStories.title: Google Releases ADK-JS: Agent Development Kit for TypeScript
topStories.summary: Google launched an open-source, code-first TypeScript toolkit for building, evaluating, and deploying AI agents with flexibility and control. The ADK-JS framework is gaining 46 stars today as developers explore structured agent development.

trendingRepos.name: anthropics/claude-code
trendingRepos.description: Claude Code continues its dominance with 511 stars gained today. The agentic coding tool now features Claude in Chrome Beta, plugin discovery search, and clickable image links.

trendingRepos.name: sgl-project/mini-sglang
trendingRepos.description: Lightweight LLM serving implementation from the SGLang team. A minimal yet powerful entry point for developers exploring fast inference engines.

trendingRepos.name: exo-explore/exo
trendingRepos.description: Run your own AI cluster at home with everyday devices. Distributed inference across phones, laptops, and desktops without expensive GPUs.

trendingRepos.name: NVIDIA-NeMo/Gym
trendingRepos.description: Build RL environments for LLM training. NVIDIA's framework for creating reinforcement learning environments optimized for large language models.

trendingSkills.name: Skill Creator
trendingSkills.description: Create effective skills to extend Claude's capabilities. A meta-skill that helps developers build new skills through specialized knowledge and tool integrations.

trendingSkills.name: CC Hooks TypeScript
trendingSkills.description: Develop type-safe Claude Code Hooks in TypeScript using the cc-hooks-ts library. Implement event-driven hooks like PreToolUse and SessionStart without sacrificing type safety.

trendingSkills.name: Git Commit Crafter
trendingSkills.description: Generate well-structured git commits following Conventional Commits. Creates atomic commits with comprehensive messages that split changes into logical, maintainable units.

trendingSkills.name: Claude Code Features Guide
trendingSkills.description: Clarifies distinctions between Claude Code's core features: Commands, Skills, Agents, Hooks, and Rules. Essential for customization decisions and context file organization.

newMcpServers.name: sqlite-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Transforms SQLite into an AI-ready database engine with advanced analytics, text and vector search, geospatial capabilities, and intelligent workflow automation. Combines standard SQL with business intelligence tools.

newMcpServers.name: arxiv-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Bridge between AI assistants and arXiv's research repository. Search papers with advanced filtering, download and store locally as markdown, run deep research analysis prompts.

newMcpServers.name: kubectl-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Enables AI assistants to interact with Kubernetes clusters via kubectl operations. Manage deployments, pods, and services through natural language commands.

newMcpServers.name: okta-mcp-fctr
newMcpServers.description: Secure Okta identity and access management via MCP. Access users, groups, applications, logs, and policies through AI assistants with enterprise-grade security.

notableHooks.name: Desktop Notification on Stop
notableHooks.description: Sends a macOS desktop notification when Claude Code completes a session. Uses osascript to display 'Claude has finished!' with a Glass sound - perfect for long-running tasks.

notableHooks.name: Auto Commit on Session End
notableHooks.description: Automatically creates Git commits when sessions end, using the user's prompt as the commit message. A Ruby script reads the transcript from stdin and stages changed files.

notableHooks.name: Multi-Branch Session Management
notableHooks.description: Isolates parallel Claude Code sessions into separate Git branches. Matches Edit|MultiEdit|Write operations and creates session-specific Git indexes at refs/heads/claude/<session-id>.

tuiTools.name: lazygit
tuiTools.description: Simple terminal UI for git commands. The most popular Git TUI with intuitive keybindings, staging, commit management, and interactive rebase support.

tuiTools.name: yazi
tuiTools.description: Blazing fast terminal file manager written in Rust based on async I/O. Features image previews, plugin system, and vi-like keybindings.

tuiTools.name: posting
tuiTools.description: The modern API client that lives in your terminal. Beautiful TUI for testing HTTP endpoints with collections, environments, and syntax highlighting.

tuiTools.name: rainfrog
tuiTools.description: Database management TUI for Postgres, MySQL, and SQLite written in Rust with Ratatui. Query execution, table browsing, and inline editing.

highlights: Clickable [Image #N] links that open attached images in default viewer
Alt-y yank-pop to cycle through kill ring history after ctrl-y yank
Plugin discovery search filtering by name, description, or marketplace
Gemini 3 Flash available with 78% SWE-bench Verified score
Persistent 'Always Allow' policies with granular shell & MCP support
Multi-file drag and drop with automatic @ prefixing
GPT-5.2-Codex: Most advanced agentic coding model with 56.4% SWE-Bench Pro
Context compaction for long-horizon work and large refactors
Splash screen and migration to new constraint-based loading

notableQuotes.quote: GPT-5.2-Codex is the most advanced agentic coding model yet for complex, real-world software engineering, with significantly stronger cybersecurity capabilities.
notableQuotes.author: OpenAI

notableQuotes.quote: Context engineering is replacing prompt engineering as the new frontier of control. It's not about clever wording anymore - it's about designing environments where AI can think with depth, consistency, and purpose.
notableQuotes.author: KDnuggets

notableQuotes.quote: In testing a dashboard TUI rendering 1,000 data points per second, the Ratatui version consistently used 30-40% less memory and had a 15% lower CPU footprint than Bubbletea.
notableQuotes.author: Developer TNG

prompt: Generated via /generate-news slash command. Claude fetches data from 9 sources in parallel (aggregated RSS feed, 7 web searches, GitHub trending via trotd, SkillsMP feed, Claude Code/Gemini CLI/Codex changelogs, Docker MCP catalog via mcp-find, YouTube trending API, Claude Code hooks docs, awesome-tuis list), deduplicates against the past 14 days of digests, then curates into structured JSON.
